channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Making Change Stick
item.description: Some advice on how to get resolutions and goals for new year to stick. Apparently this is the time when most people fall off the wagon, so it seemed the right time for this article.

item.title: An Excellent Optimization Story
item.description: Not a Perl article, but it involves Sinan and brian, so I feel honour-bound to include it. Sinan made some code run a lot quicker.

item.title: How to Strip Attachments from Email
item.description: A script from Hasan for stripping attachments from email. He's hoping to get comments and suggestions for improving his code.

item.title: Perl: Names, Logos and Who Gets To Decide
item.description: Sue's calm thoughts on the whole naming issue: both Perl 5 and Perl 6 came from Larry, so he gets to decide on the name, regardless of what any of the rest of us might think.

item.title: On the Semantic Naming of Things
item.description: Joel's allegory about the naming of Perl 6.

item.title: Why in The World Would Anyone Use Perl 6?
item.description: Zoffix's passionate support for Perl 6, in response to the brouhaha. He's having fun with Perl 6, and thinks many other people will too.

item.title: Get off my lawn
item.description: This tweet from Ovid kicked off a number of discussons, blog posts, tweet storms, and an eye roll from Aristotle.

item.title: Exploring Perl 6: Meta Operators
item.description: Mike continues his exploration of Perl 6, by looking at some meta operators.

item.title: The Perl 6 User Experience
item.description: Prompted by all the discussion and snarky comments, Zoffix has started a repository where he's trying to bring together a high-level description of "the Perl 6 experience": how to present and talk about 6.

item.title: Exploring Perl 6: Signatures, Part 1
item.description: An introduction to subroutine signatures in Perl 6.

item.title: Making your CPAN dist contribution-friendly
item.description: Some thoughts on how we can make CPAN distributions more welcoming to potential contributors.

item.title: Gaming Con event filtering and RapidApp
item.description: Gizmo presents something he knocked up with RapidApp, to making information about some gaming conferences available.

item.title: P5P summary: January 4th-10th
item.description: Updates from Tony Cook and Dave Mitchell on their grant work; some new bugs were reported, some existing bugs got fixed, and a bunch of stuff was discussed.

item.title: Next stable DBD::SQLite will be released in mid February
item.description: Ishigaki-san has a release candidate out for the next stable release of DBD::SQLite, which if all goes to plan should happen in the middle of next month.

item.title: New Dancer2 releases
item.description: Sawyer fills us in on recent releases of Dancer2.

item.title: What's new on CPAN - December 2015
item.description: David's monthly round-up of new modules on CPAN. His module of the month was Protocol::ACME.

item.title: CVE on File::Spec
item.description: 2016-01-13 The canonpath function in the File::Spec module (from the PathTools distribution) was not properly preserving the taint attribute of data. This was fixed in PathTools 3.62, released on Monday 11th January. ActivePerl has also been updated with this and another Windows-specific security fix. Strawberry Perl was also updated.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: #234 - Seconds out ...
item.description:
Plenty of back-and-forth between the Perl 5 and Perl 6 camps this week. I think this is healthy, as long as it doesn't go on too long. For one, it's a sign of people who care about their communities and programming languages.

We've also got David Farrell's review of new CPAN modules from December.

Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
